pyinterpolate.variogram.regularization.block.avg_block_to_block_semivariances module#

Functions for calculating the average block-to-block semivariances

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

Function averages block to block semivariances over specified lags.

Parameters:

  • semivariances_array (numpy array) ‚Äì [lag, semivariance, number of point pairs between blocks]

  • lags (numpy array) ‚Äì Array of lags.

  • step_size (float)

Returns:

averaged ‚Äì [lag, mean semivariances in a range, number of point pairs in range]

Return type:

pyinterpolate.variogram.regularization.block.avg_inblock_semivariances module#

Functions for calculating the inblock semivariances.

Authors#

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

calculate_average_semivariance(block_to_block_distances: Dict, inblock_semivariances: Dict, block_step_size: float, block_max_range: float) → ndarray[source]#

Function calculates average inblock semivariance between blocks.

block_to_block_distancesDict

{block id : [distances to other blocks in order of keys]}

inblock_semivariancesDict

{area id: the inblock semivariance}

block_step_sizefloat

Step size between lags.

block_max_rangefloat

Maximal distance of analysis.

avg_block_to_block_semivariancenumpy array

[lag, semivariance, number of blocks within lag]

Average inblock semivariance between blocks is defined as:

$$gamma_{h}(v, v) =

rac{1}{2*N(h)} sum_{a=1}^{N(h)} gamma(v_{a}, v_{a}) + gamma(v_{a_h}, v_{a_h})$$

where:

  • $gamma_{h}(v, v)$ - average inblock semivariance per lag,

  • $N(h)$ - number of block pairs within a lag,

  • $gamma(v_{a}, v_{a})$ - inblock semivariance of block a,

  • $gamma(v_{a_h}, v_{a_h})$ - inblock semivariance of neighbouring block at a distance h.

group_distances(block_to_block_distances: Dict, lags: ndarray, step_size: float) → Dict[source]#

Function prepares lag-neighbor-blocks Dict for semivariance calculations.

Parameters:

  • block_to_block_distances (Dict) ‚Äì {block id: [distances to all blocks in an order of dict ids]}

  • lags (numpy array) ‚Äì Array with lags.

  • step_size (float)

Returns:

grouped_lags ‚Äì {lag: {area id: [list of neighbors within a lag]}}

Return type:

Dict

pyinterpolate.variogram.regularization.block.block_to_block_semivariance module#

Functions for calculating the semivariances between blocks‚Äô point supports.

Authors#

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

block_pair_semivariance(block_a: Collection, block_b: Collection, semivariogram_model: TheoreticalVariogram)[source]#

Function calculates average semivariance between two blocks based on the counts inside the block.

Parameters:

  • block_a (Collection) ‚Äì Block A points in the form of array with each record [x, y].

  • block_b (Collection) ‚Äì Block B points in the form of array with each record [x, y].

  • semivariogram_model (TheoreticalVariogram) ‚Äì Fitted theoretical variogram model from TheoreticalVariogram class.

Returns:

semivariance_between_blocks ‚Äì The average semivariance between blocks (calculated from point every point from block a to every point in block b).

Return type:

float

calculate_block_to_block_semivariance(point_support: Union[Dict, PointSupport, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, ndarray], block_to_block_distances: Dict, semivariogram_model: TheoreticalVariogram)[source]#
Function calculates semivariance between blocks based on their point support and weighted distance between

block centroids.

Parameters:

  • point_support (Union[Dict, np.ndarray, gpd.GeoDataFrame, pd.DataFrame, PointSupport]) ‚Äì

    • Dict: {block id: [[point x, point y, value]]}

    • numpy array: [[block id, x, y, value]]

    • DataFrame and GeoDataFrame: columns={x, y, ds, index}

    • PointSupport

  • block_to_block_distances (Dict) ‚Äì {block id : [distances to other blocks in order of keys]}

  • semivariogram_model (TheoreticalVariogram) ‚Äì Fitted variogram model.

Returns:

semivariances_b2b ‚Äì {(block id a, block id b): [distance, semivariance, number of point pairs between blocks]}

Return type:

Dict

pyinterpolate.variogram.regularization.block.inblock_semivariance module#

Functions for calculating the inblock point-support semivariance.

Authors#

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

calculate_inblock_semivariance(point_support: Union[Dict, PointSupport, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, ndarray], variogram_model: TheoreticalVariogram) → Dict[source]#

Method calculates inblock semivariance of a given areas.

point_supportgeopandas GeoDataFrame | Point Support | numpy array
Point support data. It can be provided:

  • directly as PointSupport object,

  • GeoDataFrame | DataFrame (then DataFrame must have columns: ‚Äòds‚Äô - values, ‚Äòx‚Äô - point geometry x, ‚Äòy‚Äô - point geometry y, ‚Äòindex‚Äô - block indexes,

  • numpy array [block index, coordinate x, coordinate y, value],

  • Dict: {block id: [[point x, point y, value]]}.

variogram_modelTheoreticalVariogram

Modeled variogram fitted to the areal data.

inblock_semivariancesDict

{area id: the average inblock semivariance}

$$gamma(v, v) =

rac{1}{P^{2}} * sum_{s}^{P} sum_{s‚Äô}^{P} gamma(u_{s}, u_{s}‚Äô)$$

where: - $gamma(v, v)$ is the average semivariance within a block, - $P$ is a number of points used to discretize the block $v$, - $u_{s}$ is a point u within the block $v$, - $gamma(u_{s}, u_{s}‚Äô)$ is a semivariance between point $u_{s}$ and $u_{s}‚Äô$ inside the block $v$.

inblock_semivariance(points_of_block: ndarray, variogram_model: TheoreticalVariogram) → float[source]#

Function calculates inblock semivariance.

Parameters:

  • points_of_block (numpy array)

  • variogram_model (TheoreticalVariogram)

Returns:

average_block_semivariance

Return type:

float
